protocol_name: Protein Purification of Recombinant Human Tyrosinase Full Length and Intra-Melanosomal Domain
protocol_name_html: Protein Purification of Recombinant Human Tyrosinase Full Length and Intra-Melanosomal Domain
description: Human tyrosinase, a protein involved in the melanogenesis pathway, has various mutations in its corresponding gene (TYR) which have been linked to Oculocutaneous Albinism type 1 (OCA1), an autosomal recessive disease. Naturally, this inherited disorder leads to decreased melanocyte pigmentation accompanied by various visual dysfunction. Recombinant human tyrosinase was individually overexpressed in whole Trichoplusia ni (T. ni) larvae. Purification of catalytically active protein was achieved through immobilized metal affinity chromatography (IMAC) and size-exclusion chromatography (SEC). Moreover, confirmation of protein identity was accomplished using human tyrosinase-specific antibodies and mass spectrometry. Lastly, the activity for both the intra-melanosomal domain (truncated, hTyrCtr) and full length (hTyr) protein was displayed through L-DOPA and L-Tyrosine conversion into dopachrome (measured at 475 nm). This method of protein purification allows for higher yield recombinant hTyr and hTyrCtr protein from whole insect biomass to further elucidate characterization of both structure and role in human melanogenesis with the overall goal to use hTyr for enzyme replacement therapy.
before_start:
Table 1. Reagents and Solutions

* To diminish chances of air introduction all buffers should be freshly prepared, filtered and degassed before connection to chromatography system. 

** Non-ionic detergents: Triton X-100 or hydrogenated Triton X-100 (hTriton X-100).

**Truncated recombinant human tyrosinase (hTyrCtr) does not require detergent.

materials.reagent_name: Anti-Mouse IgG (whole molecule)−Alkaline Phosphatase antibody produced in goat
Fisherbrand™ accumet™ AE150 pH Benchtop Meter 3-in-1 Set
Hard Tissue Omni Tip™ Homogenizer Probes
SpectraMax i3 Multi-Mode Microplate Detection Platform
Dialysis membranes: SnakeSkin dialysis tubing or Slide-A-Lyzer dialysis cassettes, 10K MWCO
UN-SCAN-IT gel TM gel analysis software
PageRuler™ Prestained Protein Ladder, 10 to 180 kDa
Sodium Phosphate, Monobasic, Monohydrate, Molecular Biology Grade
Sodium Phosphate Dibasic Heptahydrate, ACS Reagent Grade, 500g Poly Bottle
Nitrocellulose Membrane, Precut, 0.45 µm, 7 x 8.5 cm
Extra Thick Blot Filter Paper, Precut, 7 x 8.4 cm
Mini-PROTEAN Tetra Cell for Ready Gel Precast Gels
4–15% Mini-PROTEAN® TGX™ Precast Protein Gels, 10-well, 30 µl
4–15% Mini-PROTEAN® TGX™ Precast Protein Gels, 15-well, 15 µl

warning: PTU is classified as extremely toxic. Take appropriate measures to minimize exposure to PTU powder by creating a stock solution and storing at 4°C for less than one month.
protocol_affiliation: Ophthalmic Genetics and Visual Function Branch,Laboratory of Retinal Cell and Molecular Biology, National Eye Institute, National Institutes of Health
manuscript_citation: Kus NJ, Dolinska MB, Young KL II, Dimitriadis EK, Wingfield PT, et al. (2018) Membrane-associated human tyrosinase is an enzymatically active monomeric glycoprotein. PLOS ONE 13(6): e0198247. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0198247
keywords: Human tyrosinase, recombinant protein, protein purification, membrane protein, melanosomal, OCA1, albinism
authors: Kenneth L. Young II,Monika B. Dolinska,Nicole J. Kus,Eugenia Poliakov,Yuri V. Sergeev

guidelines:
Figure 1. Schematic Overview of Tyrosinase Purification

Frozen T. ni larvae were used for tyrosinase protein purification.The larvae were homogenized (see Materials and Steps sections) then eluted through an IMAC column, dialyzed, and subsequently underwent size exclusion chromatography through two columns (Sephacryl S200 HR 16/60 & Superose 12 10/300 or Sephacryl S300 HR 16/60 & Superdex 200 Increase 10/300) followed by an IMAC (Ni-NTA Resin Gravity Flow) polishing step. Note, that the last purification step, Gravity Flow Chromatography, has shown to be not necessary for truncated tyrosinase purity (hTyrCtr).
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Equilibrate a HisTrap FF Crude 5 ml immobilized metal affinity chromatography (IMAC) column with 5 column volumes of Buffer B.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Equilibrate a HisTrap FF Crude 5 ml immobilized metal affinity chromatography (IMAC) column with 5 column volumes of Buffer B.

components.data: Recombinant human tyrosinase concentration is ascertained using NanoDrop spectrophotometer at A280nm/260nm on NanoDrop software after each chromatography step within “Protein Purification” section for hTyrCtr and hTyr (in the presence of hydrogenated Triton X-100 only). See Note 12 & 13.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Recombinant human tyrosinase concentration is ascertained using NanoDrop spectrophotometer at A280nm/260nm on NanoDrop software after each chromatography step within “Protein Purification” section for hTyrCtr and hTyr (in the presence of hydrogenated Triton X-100 only). See Note 12 & 13.

components.data: Through the use of a baculovirus vector expression in SF9 cells, recombinant full length (hTyr) and truncated (hTyrCtr) human tyrosinase were commercially produced in whole insect Trichoplusia ni (T. ni ) larvae. Moreover, a C-terminus 6XHis-tag, as well as a substitution of the native signal peptide (residues 1-21) with an insect signal peptide sequence, were added and serve to facilitate protein purification and enhance expression (Figure 2). The construct and biomass were prepared commercially where the latter was stored at -80°C (See External Link Below).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Through the use of a baculovirus vector expression in SF9 cells, recombinant full length (hTyr) and truncated (hTyrCtr) human tyrosinase were commercially produced in whole insect Trichoplusia ni (T. ni ) larvae. Moreover, a C-terminus 6XHis-tag, as well as a substitution of the native signal peptide (residues 1-21) with an insect signal peptide sequence, were added and serve to facilitate protein purification and enhance expression (Figure 2). The construct and biomass were prepared commercially where the latter was stored at -80°C (See External Link Below).

components.data:
Figure 2. Full length and truncated human tyrosinase sequence alignment

 

 

 

 

 

Note, hTyrCtr retains all histidine and asparagine residues thought to be critical for tyrosinase’s catalytic function and structure.  The C-termius 6X His-tag is highlighted in purple. The six histidine residues coordinating the divalent metal ion Cu2+ is denoted by grey highlight. Conserved asparagine sites linked oligosaccharide glycosylation are highlighted in green.

components.data: While in cold Buffer A, disrupt larvae tissue with Omni Tissue Homogenizer using Hard Tissue Omni TipTM Homogenizer Probes for approximately 2 minutes at maximum speed (or until the mixture resembles a homogenous purée).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: While in cold Buffer A, disrupt larvae tissue with Omni Tissue Homogenizer using Hard Tissue Omni TipTM Homogenizer Probes for approximately 2 minutes at maximum speed (or until the mixture resembles a homogenous purée).

components.data: Incubate the homogenate at room temperature on the Obitron Rotator for 30 minutes for DNAse I activation in a graduated glass media bottle. See Note 4.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the homogenate at room temperature on the Obitron Rotator for 30 minutes for DNAse I activation in a graduated glass media bottle. See Note 4.

components.data: Continuously sonicate for 10 minutes with the Ultrasonic Processor while still on ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Continuously sonicate for 10 minutes with the Ultrasonic Processor while still on ice.

components.data: Place frozen infected larvae in 50 ml conical tubes with 25 ml of lysis buffer (Buffer A, Table 1) per 5 grams of larvae (5x vol/weight ratio). Ice-cold buffer should be added immediately before tissue disruption; melting and subsequent darkening of larvae could cause sample loss. See Notes 1-3.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place frozen infected larvae in 50 ml conical tubes with 25 ml of lysis buffer (Buffer A, Table 1) per 5 grams of larvae (5x vol/weight ratio). Ice-cold buffer should be added immediately before tissue disruption; melting and subsequent darkening of larvae could cause sample loss. See Notes 1-3.

components.data: The sample should be diluted in a 1:1 (vol/vol) ratio with Buffer B. See Note 5.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The sample should be diluted in a 1:1 (vol/vol) ratio with Buffer B. See Note 5.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 10 of Recombinant Human Tyrosinase Full-Length and Intra-Melanosomal Domains: Protein Purification
source_data.protocol_name: Protein Purification of Recombinant Human Tyrosinase Full Length and Intra-Melanosomal Domain
source_data.protocol_name_html: Protein Purification of Recombinant Human Tyrosinase Full Length and Intra-Melanosomal Domain
source_data.annotation:
NOTE1 

hTyrCtr is purified in the absence of detergent, so both Triton X-100 and hydrogenated Triton X-100 should be omitted from all buffers. 

 

NOTE2 

It is critical for larvae to be kept on ice thoughout homogenization unless otherwise noted.

 

NOTE3 

PTU must be present in the lysis buffer (Buffer A) to prevent larval darkening due to endogenous tyrosinase.

 

NOTE4 

Ensure the mixture is placed back on ice following room temperature incubation.

 

NOTE5 

We have noticed better binding to and elution from the IMAC column when ice is no longer used after this step.

NOTE1 

hTyrCtr is purified in the absence of detergent, so both Triton X-100 and hydrogenated Triton X-100 should be omitted from all buffers. 

 

NOTE2 

It is critical for larvae to be kept on ice thoughout homogenization unless otherwise noted.

 

NOTE3 

PTU must be present in the lysis buffer (Buffer A) to prevent larval darkening due to endogenous tyrosinase.

 

NOTE4 

Ensure the mixture is placed back on ice following room temperature incubation.

 

NOTE5 

We have noticed better binding to and elution from the IMAC column when ice is no longer used after this step.

components.data: Filter supernatant through filter paper with a pore size of > 20 μm to remove excess lipids and potentially disturbed pellet back into the graduated media bottle.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Filter supernatant through filter paper with a pore size of > 20 μm to remove excess lipids and potentially disturbed pellet back into the graduated media bottle.

components.data: Transfer suspension into centrifuge tubes and centrifuge the sample for 30 minutes at 8,000 RPM and 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer suspension into centrifuge tubes and centrifuge the sample for 30 minutes at 8,000 RPM and 4°C.

components.data: Pool active fractions and dialyze at 4°C against at least two liters of Buffer D overnight on a magnetic stirrer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pool active fractions and dialyze at 4°C against at least two liters of Buffer D overnight on a magnetic stirrer.

components.data: Incubate the mixture at 37°C for 30 min and measure dopachrome formation at 475 nm. See Note 8.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the mixture at 37°C for 30 min and measure dopachrome formation at 475 nm. See Note 8.

components.data: Place 50 μL of L-DOPA stock + 50 μL of Buffer E in 1 well for L-DOPA oxidation comparison (blank).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place 50 μL of L-DOPA stock + 50 μL of Buffer E in 1 well for L-DOPA oxidation comparison (blank).

components.data: Add fractions believed to contain tyrosinase in a 1:1 ratio (100 μL of L-DOPA/tyrosinase mixture used in 96 well plate).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add fractions believed to contain tyrosinase in a 1:1 ratio (100 μL of L-DOPA/tyrosinase mixture used in 96 well plate).

components.data: Indicate the presence of tyrosinase by its diphenol oxidase activity through a color reaction test, with L-DOPA as a substrate. Prepare 3 mM stock of L-DOPA by solubilizing L-DOPA by either <1 minute of boiling or 1 hour at room temperature. L-DOPA must be prepared fresh and solubilized within Buffer E, 10 mM sodium phosphate buffer. Boiling for more than 1 minute causes oxidation of substrate. See Note 7.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Indicate the presence of tyrosinase by its diphenol oxidase activity through a color reaction test, with L-DOPA as a substrate. Prepare 3 mM stock of L-DOPA by solubilizing L-DOPA by either <1 minute of boiling or 1 hour at room temperature. L-DOPA must be prepared fresh and solubilized within Buffer E, 10 mM sodium phosphate buffer. Boiling for more than 1 minute causes oxidation of substrate. See Note 7.
Collect 2.5 ml fractions.

components.data: Elute from the column using a 0-500 mM gradient of imidazole at a flow rate of 1 ml/min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Elute from the column using a 0-500 mM gradient of imidazole at a flow rate of 1 ml/min.

components.data: Load the diluted crude extract sample onto the IMAC column at a flow rate of 0.2 ml/min.See Note 6.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Load the diluted crude extract sample onto the IMAC column at a flow rate of 0.2 ml/min.See Note 6.

components.data: Then, 5 column volumes of Buffer C. Followed by 5 more column volumes of Buffer B.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Then, 5 column volumes of Buffer C. Followed by 5 more column volumes of Buffer B.

components.data: Following dialysis, concentrate the protein to approximately 1-5 ml.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Following dialysis, concentrate the protein to approximately 1-5 ml.

components.data: Apply sample, collect fractions, and subject to L-DOPA colorimetric assay. Pool active hTyr fractions.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Apply sample, collect fractions, and subject to L-DOPA colorimetric assay. Pool active hTyr fractions.

components.data: Use a pre-equilibrated Superdex 200 Increase 10/300 GL or Superose 12 10/300 GL column, with at least two column volumes of buffer D with a flow rate of 0.5 ml/min, for second SEC. See Note 10.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use a pre-equilibrated Superdex 200 Increase 10/300 GL or Superose 12 10/300 GL column, with at least two column volumes of buffer D with a flow rate of 0.5 ml/min, for second SEC. See Note 10.

components.data: Concentrate fractions to 250-500 μL.Tyrosinase activity is monitored using enzymatic L-DOPA assay.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Concentrate fractions to 250-500 μL.Tyrosinase activity is monitored using enzymatic L-DOPA assay.

components.data: Use SDS-PAGE and Western Blotting to confirm protein presence, as well as a check for purity.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use SDS-PAGE and Western Blotting to confirm protein presence, as well as a check for purity.
Collect 2 ml fractions throughout the run.

components.data: Further purify the concentrated protein sample by size-exclusion chromatography (SEC) by either HiPrep Sephacryl S-200 16/60 HR or HiPrep Sephacryl S-300 16/60 HR column. Pre-equilibrate with at least two column volumes of Buffer D, with a flow rate of 0.5 ml/min. Load the column with the sample. See Note 10 & 11.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Further purify the concentrated protein sample by size-exclusion chromatography (SEC) by either HiPrep Sephacryl S-200 16/60 HR or HiPrep Sephacryl S-300 16/60 HR column. Pre-equilibrate with at least two column volumes of Buffer D, with a flow rate of 0.5 ml/min. Load the column with the sample. See Note 10 & 11.

components.data: Dialysis membranes: Slide-A-Lyzer dialysis cassettes or SnakeSkin dialysis tubing, both at 10 kDa MWCO. See Note 9.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dialysis membranes: Slide-A-Lyzer dialysis cassettes or SnakeSkin dialysis tubing, both at 10 kDa MWCO. See Note 9.

components.data: *The Elution will contain pure Tyrosinase as confirmed by SDS-PAGE, western, and activity.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: *The Elution will contain pure Tyrosinase as confirmed by SDS-PAGE, western, and activity.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 49 of Recombinant Human Tyrosinase Full-Length and Intra-Melanosomal Domains: Protein Purification
source_data.protocol_name: Protein Purification of Recombinant Human Tyrosinase Full Length and Intra-Melanosomal Domain
source_data.protocol_name_html: Protein Purification of Recombinant Human Tyrosinase Full Length and Intra-Melanosomal Domain
source_data.annotation:
NOTE6

Loading of the IMAC column must be done slowly to be most effective; thus, the flow rate should not exceed a flow rate above 0.5 ml/min as it may compress the column.

 

NOTE7

L-Tyrosine can also be used instead of L-DOPA to measure protein activity. Naturally, the monophenolase and subsequent dipehnol oxidase activity takes longer to form dopachrome; thus, we used the L-DOPA reaction to spot check protein's presence.

 

 

NOTE8

Ensure L-DOPA/tyrosinase solution reaches the required 37°C temperature before starting measurement of protein activity.

 

NOTE9 

It is important to dialyze collected fractions before concentration to remove imidazole and to prevent protein aggregation during protein concentration.

 

NOTE10

SEC Post Dialysis:

hTyr in the presence of Triton X-100 was purfied with the HiPrep Sephacryl S-200 HR and Superose 12 10/ 300 GL columns. 

 

Both hTyrCtr and  hTyr in the presence of hydrogenated Triton X-100 was purified with  HiPrep Sephacryl S-300 HR and  Superdex 200 Increase 10/ 300 GL columns. 

 

NOTE11

All size-exclusion columns are calibrated using Biorad protein standards: Thyroglobulin (670 kDa), γ-globulin (158 kDa), Ovalbumin (44 kDa), Myoglobin (17 kDa), and Vitamin B12 (1.4 kDa).

NOTE7

L-Tyrosine can also be used instead of L-DOPA to measure protein activity. Naturally, the monophenolase and subsequent dipehnol oxidase activity takes longer to form dopachrome; thus, we used the L-DOPA reaction to spot check protein's presence.

hTyr in the presence of Triton X-100 was purfied with the HiPrep Sephacryl S-200 HR and Superose 12 10/ 300 GL columns.

components.data:
The column can be reconstituted as follows:

 

Wash with 10 mls NaOH; then

Wash with 10 mls DiH2O; lastly

Wash with 10 mls 20% Ethanol

Store in 20% Ethanol at 4C
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
The column can be reconstituted as follows:

 

Wash with 10 mls NaOH; then

Wash with 10 mls DiH2O; lastly

Wash with 10 mls 20% Ethanol

Store in 20% Ethanol at 4C

components.data:
Wash and elute protein as follows (transferring the column into a new tube after draining at each step):

 

Wash one is done with 2 mls of Buffer B

Elution* is done with 2 mls of Buffer C

A second wash is done with 2 mls Buffer B
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Wash and elute protein as follows (transferring the column into a new tube after draining at each step):

 

Wash one is done with 2 mls of Buffer B

Elution* is done with 2 mls of Buffer C

A second wash is done with 2 mls Buffer B

components.data: After the last cycle, save flow through and transfer the column into a new conical tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After the last cycle, save flow through and transfer the column into a new conical tube.

components.data: Recycle flow through at least six times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Recycle flow through at least six times.

components.data: Place pooled active fractions, from the second chromatography step above, onto the column.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place pooled active fractions, from the second chromatography step above, onto the column.

components.data: Place the column into a new 15 ml conical tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the column into a new 15 ml conical tube.
Lastly, another 10 mls of Buffer B.
Then add 2 mls of Buffer C.

components.data: Let the storage solution drain. Once completely drained add 10 mls of Buffer B.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let the storage solution drain. Once completely drained add 10 mls of Buffer B.

components.data: hTyr requires a polishing step. Place a Poly-Prep Chromatography Column into a 15 ml conical tube with 1 ml of the Ni-NTA agarose inside the column.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: hTyr requires a polishing step. Place a Poly-Prep Chromatography Column into a 15 ml conical tube with 1 ml of the Ni-NTA agarose inside the column.

components.data: Final tyrosinase product is identfied for quality through MALDI TOF/TOF Mass Spectrometry. See Note 14.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Final tyrosinase product is identfied for quality through MALDI TOF/TOF Mass Spectrometry. See Note 14.

components.data: Western blot analysis using T311 Tyrosinase monoclonal antibodies produced in mouse (1:2000 ratio) and secondary antibody, anti-mouse IgG, produced in goat (1:1000 ratio) is used to identify tyrosinase.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Western blot analysis using T311 Tyrosinase monoclonal antibodies produced in mouse (1:2000 ratio) and secondary antibody, anti-mouse IgG, produced in goat (1:1000 ratio) is used to identify tyrosinase.

components.data: Evaluation of purity through UN-SCAN-IT gel TM gel analysis software from SDS-PAGE gels using the following formula:
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Evaluation of purity through UN-SCAN-IT gel TM gel analysis software from SDS-PAGE gels using the following formula:

components.data: SDS-PAGE, with a 4% -15% gradient, is used to check for purity. We have not noticed aggregation of the full length tyrosinase protein when samples are boiled in the classical Laemmli sample buffer ratio 1:1 before electrophoresis.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: SDS-PAGE, with a 4% -15% gradient, is used to check for purity. We have not noticed aggregation of the full length tyrosinase protein when samples are boiled in the classical Laemmli sample buffer ratio 1:1 before electrophoresis.

components.data: In the end, the tyrosinase product should display a purity of >95% via SDS-PAGE to avoid non-specific interactions. Tyrosinase oligomeric state and molecular mass are determined using analytic ultra-centrifugation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: In the end, the tyrosinase product should display a purity of >95% via SDS-PAGE to avoid non-specific interactions. Tyrosinase oligomeric state and molecular mass are determined using analytic ultra-centrifugation.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 58 of Recombinant Human Tyrosinase Full-Length and Intra-Melanosomal Domains: Protein Purification
source_data.protocol_name: Protein Purification of Recombinant Human Tyrosinase Full Length and Intra-Melanosomal Domain
source_data.protocol_name_html: Protein Purification of Recombinant Human Tyrosinase Full Length and Intra-Melanosomal Domain
source_data.annotation:
NOTE12 

The protein concentration of hTyr in the presence of Triton X-100 was measured using the bicinchoninic acid (BCA) assay due to it's inherent lack of optical transparency.

 

NOTE13 

Protein concentration should be determined for both diluted crude extract and flow through from IMAC column using A280nm/260nm. Furthermore, all fractions from columns should be subjected to the enzymatic L-DOPA assay to check for activity with the SpectraMax i3 Multi-mode Microplate Detection Platform SoftMaxPro 7.

 

NOTE14 

Unpublished data
